wikipedia_page.main: Anne Lipow (February 27, 1935 – September 9, 2004) was a prominent librarian who worked at the University of California, Berkeley Libraries before retiring from Berkeley and starting her own business, Library Solutions Institute and Press, in 1992.

response: *Anne Grodzins Lipow – founder of Library Solutions Institute and Press

Romm was born and grew up in Middletown, New York, the youngest of three sons of Al Romm (1926–1999), managing editor of the Times Herald-Record newspaper,Al Romm was managing editor of the Times Herald-Record newspaper from the 1950s into the 1980s. His sister Anne Grodzins Lipow was a librarian and library science expert,"Lipow, Anne Grodzins", Obituary, SFGate.com, September 12, 2004, accessed July 12, 2016 and his sister Ethel Grodzins Romm was an author, project manager, CEO and Co-Chair of the Lyceum Society of the New York Academy of Sciences."The Workmen's Circle to Honor Activists Ethel Grodzins Romm & Joe Romm at 2016 Winter Benefit", BroadwayWorld.com, October 20, 2016

Romm was born in Lowell, Massachusetts, the daughter of David Melvin Grodzins and his wife Taube Grodzins, Jewish emigrants, with roots in Poland and Grodno, Belarus.Kawasaki, Guy. "Ethel Grodzins Romm" in Hindsights: The Wisdom and Breakthroughs of Remarkable People, Beyond Words Publishing (1994) , pp. 11–17 She grew up in Manchester, New Hampshire, and graduated from Manchester Central High School in 1942.
